turns.content: list all of the miracles that Jesus performed as recorded in the Bible book of Matthew, ordered by chapter sequence

Sure, here are the miracles of Jesus recorded in the book of Matthew, ordered by chapter sequence:

* Matthew 4:23-24 - Jesus healed all kinds of sickness and disease among the people.
* Matthew 8:2-3 - Jesus healed a man with leprosy.
* Matthew 8:5-13 - Jesus healed the servant of a Roman army officer who had great faith.
* Matthew 8:14-15 - Jesus healed Peter's mother-in-law of a fever.
* Matthew 8:16-17 - Jesus healed all who were sick, fulfilling the prophecy of Isaiah.
* Matthew 9:1-8 - Jesus healed a paralyzed man who was brought to him.
* Matthew 9:18-26 - Jesus raised a girl from the dead and healed a woman who had been bleeding for 12 years.
* Matthew 9:27-31 - Jesus healed two blind men who had great faith.
* Matthew 12:9-14 - Jesus healed a man with a withered hand.
* Matthew 14:13-21 - Jesus fed a crowd of 5,000 men, plus women and children, with just five loaves of bread and two fish.
* Matthew 14:22-33 - Jesus walked on water and calmed a storm.
* Matthew 15:29-31 - Jesus healed many people who were lame, blind, mute, and crippled, among others.
* Matthew 17:14-18 - Jesus healed a boy possessed by a demon.
* Matthew 20:29-34 - Jesus healed two blind men who were sitting by the roadside.
* Matthew 21:18-22 - Jesus cursed a fig tree and it withered away, showing his power and authority.
* Matthew 27:50-53 - At Jesus' death, many tombs were opened and many people were resurrected, appearing to many in the city.

These are the miracles recorded in the book of Matthew, according to the New World Translation of the Holy Scriptures.
list all of the miracles that Jesus performed as recorded in the Bible book of Mark, ordered by chapter sequence

Certainly! Here are the miracles of Jesus recorded in the book of Mark, ordered by chapter sequence:

* Mark 1:23-26 - Jesus cast out an unclean spirit from a man in the synagogue.
* Mark 1:29-31 - Jesus healed Simon's mother-in-law of a fever.
* Mark 1:32-34 - Jesus healed many who were sick and cast out many demons.
* Mark 1:40-45 - Jesus healed a man with leprosy.
* Mark 2:1-12 - Jesus healed a paralyzed man who was lowered through the roof of a house.
* Mark 3:1-6 - Jesus healed a man with a withered hand.
* Mark 4:35-41 - Jesus calmed a storm on the sea.
* Mark 5:1-20 - Jesus cast out a legion of demons from a man who lived among the tombs.
* Mark 5:21-43 - Jesus healed a woman who had been bleeding for 12 years and raised a girl from the dead.
* Mark 6:30-44 - Jesus fed a crowd of 5,000 men with five loaves of bread and two fish.
* Mark 6:45-52 - Jesus walked on water and calmed a storm.
* Mark 7:31-37 - Jesus healed a man who was deaf and had a speech impediment.
* Mark 8:1-10 - Jesus fed a crowd of 4,000 men with seven loaves of bread and a few fish.
* Mark 8:22-26 - Jesus healed a blind man in two stages, first making him see men like trees walking, and then fully restoring his sight.
* Mark 9:14-29 - Jesus healed a boy possessed by an unclean spirit.
* Mark 10:46-52 - Jesus healed a blind man named Bartimaeus.
* Mark 11:12-14, 20-21 - Jesus cursed a fig tree and it withered away, showing his power and authority.
* Mark 15:33-41 - At Jesus' death, the veil of the temple was torn in two from top to bottom, and a centurion declared him to be the Son of God.

These are the miracles of Jesus recorded in the book of Mark, according to the New World Translation of the Holy Scriptures.
list all of the miracles that Jesus performed as recorded in the Bible book of Luke, ordered by chapter sequence

Certainly! Here are the miracles of Jesus recorded in the book of Luke, ordered by chapter sequence:

* Luke 4:33-36 - Jesus cast out an unclean spirit from a man in the synagogue.
* Luke 4:38-39 - Jesus healed Simon's mother-in-law of a fever.
* Luke 4:40-41 - Jesus healed many who were sick and cast out many demons.
* Luke 5:1-11 - Jesus caused a great catch of fish and called his first disciples.
* Luke 5:12-16 - Jesus healed a man with leprosy.
* Luke 5:17-26 - Jesus healed a paralyzed man who was lowered through the roof of a house.
* Luke 6:6-11 - Jesus healed a man with a withered hand.
* Luke 7:1-10 - Jesus healed a servant of a centurion who had great faith.
* Luke 7:11-17 - Jesus raised a widow's son from the dead.
* Luke 7:18-23 - Jesus healed many who were blind, lame, and sick, among others, and declared that the good news was being preached to the poor.
* Luke 8:22-25 - Jesus calmed a storm on the sea.
* Luke 8:26-39 - Jesus cast out a legion of demons from a man who lived among the tombs.
* Luke 8:40-56 - Jesus healed a woman who had been bleeding for 12 years and raised a girl from the dead.
* Luke 9:10-17 - Jesus fed a crowd of 5,000 men with five loaves of bread and two fish.
* Luke 9:37-43 - Jesus healed a boy possessed by an unclean spirit.
* Luke 13:10-17 - Jesus healed a woman who had been bent over for 18 years.
* Luke 14:1-6 - Jesus healed a man with dropsy on the Sabbath.
* Luke 17:11-19 - Jesus healed 10 men who had leprosy, but only one returned to thank him.
* Luke 18:35-43 - Jesus healed a blind man near Jericho.
* Luke 22:50-51 - Jesus healed the ear of a servant of the high priest that had been cut off by one of his disciples.

These are the miracles of Jesus recorded in the book of Luke, according to the New World Translation of the Holy Scriptures.
list all of the miracles that Jesus performed as recorded in the Bible book of John, ordered by chapter sequence

Certainly! Here are the miracles of Jesus recorded in the book of John, ordered by chapter sequence:

* John 2:1-11 - Jesus turned water into wine at a wedding in Cana.
* John 4:46-54 - Jesus healed a nobleman's son who was near death.
* John 5:1-9 - Jesus healed a man who had been an invalid for 38 years.
* John 6:5-14 - Jesus fed a crowd of 5,000 men with five loaves of bread and two fish.
* John 6:16-21 - Jesus walked on water and calmed a storm.
* John 9:1-12 - Jesus healed a man who had been blind from birth.
* John 11:1-44 - Jesus raised Lazarus from the dead.

These are the miracles of Jesus recorded in the book of John, according to the New World Translation of the Holy Scriptures.
Create a comprehensive list of the miracles performed by Jesus as described in the four gospel Bible books. For each miracle, indicate where the event is described in each gospel Bible books

Certainly! Here is a comprehensive list of the miracles performed by Jesus as described in the four gospel Bible books, along with the chapters and verses where each event is described:

1. Jesus turned water into wine at a wedding in Cana. (John 2:1-11)
2. Jesus healed a nobleman's son who was near death. (John 4:46-54)
3. Jesus healed a man with an unclean spirit in a synagogue. (Mark 1:21-28, Luke 4:31-37)
4. Jesus healed Simon Peter's mother-in-law of a fever. (Matthew 8:14-15, Mark 1:29-31, Luke 4:38-39)
5. Jesus healed many who were sick and cast out many demons. (Mark 1:32-34, Luke 4:40-41)
6. Jesus caused a great catch of fish and called his first disciples. (Luke 5:1-11)
7. Jesus healed a man with leprosy. (Matthew 8:2-4, Mark 1:40-45, Luke 5:12-16)
8. Jesus healed a paralyzed man who was lowered through the roof of a house. (Matthew 9:1-8, Mark 2:1-12, Luke 5:17-26)
9. Jesus healed a man with a withered hand. (Matthew 12:9-14, Mark 3:1-6, Luke 6:6-11)
10. Jesus healed a centurion's servant who had great faith. (Matthew 8:5-13, Luke 7:1-10)
11. Jesus raised a widow's son from the dead. (Luke 7:11-17)
12. Jesus healed many who were blind, lame, and sick, among others. (Matthew 9:27-34, 12:22-23, 14:34-36, 15:29-31, 20:29-34, 21:14, Mark 8:22-26, 10:46-52, Luke 7:18-23, 8:43-48, 13:10-17, 18:35-43, John 9:1-41)
13. Jesus calmed a storm on the sea. (Matthew 8:23-27, Mark 4:35-41, Luke 8:22-25)
14. Jesus cast out a legion of demons from a man who lived among the tombs. (Matthew 8:28-34, Mark 5:1-20, Luke 8:26-39)
15. Jesus healed a woman who had been bleeding for 12 years and raised a girl from the dead. (Matthew 9:18-26, Mark 5:21-43, Luke 8:40-56)
16. Jesus fed a crowd of 5,000 men with five loaves of bread and two fish. (Matthew 14:13-21, Mark 6:30-44, Luke 9:10-17, John 6:5-14)
17. Jesus healed a boy possessed by an unclean spirit. (Matthew 17:14-21, Mark 9:14-29, Luke 9:37-43)
18. Jesus healed a blind man near Jericho. (Matthew 20:29-34, Mark 10:46-52, Luke 18:35-43)
19. Jesus healed a man with dropsy on the Sabbath. (Luke 14:1-6)
20. Jesus healed
